The BioCatalogue Roadmap

Please note that the time scales listed are estimated. New requirements and changes in the user community may affect the delivery dates and schedule.


First quarter of 2009 (Jan - Mar)

  • Private pilot (private beta) - Basic SOAP services registration, discovery and annotation. Batch upload of soaplab services.
  • Better service discovery and filtering - Search result sorting and filtering (by providers and services types) and more faceted browsing features. At a glance counts of annotations on services.
  • Service annotation support - Simple tagging and functional description of services, operations, their inputs and outputs. Support for service operation inputs and outputs examples. Support for comments and discussion threads about services. Annotation provided by submitters, providers, expert curators and automated agents.
  • REST services support - Ability to register, describe and search for REST services in BioCatalogue.
  • Content acquisition (I) - Import Feta annotation. Providers, experts and users' service registration and annotation.


Second quarter of 2009 (Apr - Jun)

  • Public pilot (public beta) - First public release - see The Pilot
  • Service monitoring - availability - We will regularly monitor the service, by checking the host, endpoints, WSDL and so on.
  • Service monitoring - testing - Test scripts to test out service functionality can be provided by submitters and service providers. We then run these regularly to provide us with metrics on the availability/reliability. A traffic light system (red, green, amber) gives users an at-a-glance view on status.
  • Semantic annotation support - Ability to annotate service using ontologies (and possibly export semantically annotated services in different formats such as SAWSDL, SA-REST).
  • Enhanced search functionality - Similarity searches. Semantic search: search for services using terms from a defined ontology. Amazon-like search: people who searched for these also searched for those.
  • Public APIs (I) - Basic RESTful APIs to BioCatalogue (mainly read).
  • Integration with myExperiment - Services from BioCatalogue displayed in myExperiment so users of myExperiment can browse them.
  • Content acquisition (II) - Merge with the EMBRACE registry. Scavenge services from SeekDa and ProgrammableWeb.
  • BioMoby services support - Ability to register and search for BioMoby services.


Third quarter 2009 (Jul - Sep)

  • Subscribe to a service - RSS/ATOM feeds for services, providing information on all activity on a service within BioCatalogue.
  • Notifications and new feeds - RSS/ATOM feeds and email notifications to keep users informed of new and updated services in BioCatalogue.
  • Advanced service discovery and filtering - Filtering by multiple tags, providers, service types, locations, and so on.


Fourth quarter 2009 (Oct - Dec)

  • Public APIs (II) - More functional RESTful APIs to BioCatalogue (read and write).
  • Service usage metrics - Usage metrics collection and provider metrics submission. RSS/ATOM feeds and email notifications for these metrics.
  • “Try it now” service functionality - Ability to test and play with a service within the BioCatalogue interface before using it.
  • Integration with Taverna - Ability to import Web Services and annotations to and from BioCatalogue and Taverna.


2010

  • myBioCatalogue - Ability to set up your own local BioCatalogue registry.
  • Curation workbench/tools - New curation tools designed for expert curators.
